content.question: Let <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded above by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, 3 x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and below by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, x squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following gives the volume of the solid generated when region <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></math> is revolved about the vertical line <math alttext="x equals, negative 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to 9, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, the square root of y, end root, plus 3, close parenthesis, minus, open parenthesis, the fraction y over 3, end fraction, plus 3, close parenthesis, close parenthesis, squared, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>π</mi><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to 9, of, open parenthesis, the square root of y, end root, minus the fraction y over 3, close parenthesis, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to 9, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, the square root of y, close parenthesis, squared, minus, open parenthesis, the fraction y over 3, close parenthesis, squared, close parenthesis, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>π</mi><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to 9, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, the square root of y, end root, plus 3, close parenthesis, squared, minus, open parenthesis, the fraction y over 3, end fraction, plus 3, close parenthesis, squared, close parenthesis, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to 9, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, the square root of y, end root, plus 3, close parenthesis, squared, minus, open parenthesis, the fraction y over 3, end fraction, plus 3, close parenthesis, squared, close parenthesis, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.12: Volume with Washer Method - Revolving Around Other Axes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
